ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Rerunning HTML form login
ygData.msgSnippet: Andy, have you read the link cited below? If it is an insufficent description of the login functionality, I would like to know so I can redress. Thanks, St.Ack

Andy, have you read the link cited below? If it is an insufficent
description of the login functionality, I would like to know so I can
redress.

Thanks,
St.Ack


AndyFrun wrote:
> Hello, Samuel,
> I am trying to use HTML form credentials too. But I didn't know how to
> do it. Can you tell me where did you set your username/password pairs
> for the login forms?
> Really thanks a lot!
> Best,
> Andy
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> [archive-crawler] Re: Rerunning HTML form login
> Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> > Check out
> > http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#credentials. Does
> > this help?
> > St.Ack
> >
>
> Well, I've already managed to login successfully on several hosts
> using HTML form credentials, but lately I've been getting some
> InvalidAttributeValueException like if my inputs were all left blank.
> But they're not. I checked the order file and its ok.
> But It works fine if I put the inputs myself on the order.xml
>
> Heres the warning:
>
> +0000 SEVERE org.archive.crawler.admin.ui.JobConfigureUtils
> writeAttribute Setting attribute value null on
> /crawl-order/credential-store/credentials/FolhaFORM/form-items/coringa:
> Value of illegal type: 'null', 'java.lang.String' was expected.
>
> Heres the full stacktrace:
>

> type: 'null', 'java.lang.String' was expected.

> About that other issue (rerunning the login). Some inputs are
> generated by the server based on my IP and God knows what...thats why
> I wanted to retry the post. Apparently thats not possible right?
> (6.2.3.2.4. Known Limitations)
>
> Thanks
